layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: When I do something wrong, I own it rather than making excuses, minimizing, or shifting blame to circumstances.
I take responsibility for the impact of my actions on others, including unintended consequences.
questions.principle: Own your impact, not just your intent

questions.text: When confronted with a moral failure, I resist the urge to defend myself or point to what others did.
I recognize that my integrity is my responsibility — no one else can give it to me or take it away without my participation.
When I'm convicted of something, I own that addressing it is my job — I don't wait for someone else to fix it or hold me accountable.
